intro: Klainedoxa gabonensis var. trillesii, commonly known as the Gabon waxtree, is a perennial shrub native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves that are often covered in a fine, white bloom. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are typically surrounded by modified leaves called cyathia. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
